body.p: present: [2.] sū́te súvate etc. V.+ suvāná svāná? sauti B.+ suhi sūhi -- [6.] suváti etc. sva suvate etc. -- [4.] sūyate etc. B1.+ sūyati etc. E.+ -- [1.] savati etc. E.+
aorist: [1.] asāvi -- [3.] asūṣavat asuṣot asuṣavus -- [4.] asauṣīt soṣṭa U.+ -- [5.] asāvīt etc. sāviṣat asaviṣṭa
future: [1.] soṣyáti soṣyáte etc. B.+ sū́ṣyant saviṣyati saviṣyate etc. E.+ -- [2.] sotā savitā
secondary: passive: sūyáte etc. V.+ -- intensive: soṣavīti -- desiderative: susūṣa- -- causative: sāvaya-

derivatives: sū́ V.+ savá V.+ sávya? (n.) RV. -savin C. sávana V.+ -súvana AV. -savas B.S. sū́ti V.+ -suti RV. sū́tu AV. savitṛ́ V.+ -savītṛ RV. sūtrī́ AV. strī́? V.+ savatha? C. -sūna S.+ sūnú V.+ -sū́ma V. -sū́ya AV.+ sū́ra? V. sūrí? V.+ sávīman V.B.S. -sū́van V. sūṣā́ AV. sūṣaṇā? AV.

Usually divided into two roots, 1su/sū 'impel', and 2su/sū 'give birth' (the verb-forms of the former, with three or four sporadic exceptions, limited to the older language); but their forms and meanings are mixed beyond the possibility of successful separation.
